data.title: Carve out an ellipse
data.statement:
Start off with a 31 x 31 [[rectangle]], filled with [[symbol]]

In the <<exact>> middle of that [[rectangle]] carve out (remove) an [[ellipse]].

An arbitrary point (X,Y) is inside an ellipse whose center is (0,0) if `(X/a)^2 + (Y/b)^2 - 1 < 0`
[[a]] and [[b]] are given as positive integers in the input.



~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Source:
https://forums.ni.com/t5/LabVIEW/How-to-detect-if-point-is-within-ellipse/td-p/433848

data.stubGenerator:
read symbol:word(1) a:int b:int
write a centered and carved out ellipse

STATEMENT
An arbitrary point (X,Y) is inside an ellipse whose center is (0,0) if (x/a)^2 + (y/b)^2 - 1 < 0
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> the [[symbol]] (a 1-character string), followed by [[a]], followed by [[b]] (all separated by a space)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Start off with a 31 x 31 rectangle, filled with symbol

In the exact middle of that rectangle carve out (remove) an ellipse.

An arbitrary point (X,Y) is inside an ellipse whose center is (0,0) if 
(X/a)^2 + (Y/b)^2 - 1 < 0

a and b are given as positive integers in the input.



~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Source:
https://forums.ni.com/t5/LabVIEW/How-to-detect-if-point-is-within-ellipse/td-p/433848
Input
Line 1: the symbol (a 1-character string), followed by a, followed by b (all separated by a space)
Output
31 Lines: rectangle minus ellipse shape
Constraints
Example
Input
~ 7 9
Output
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
